headline: Southern Extends 78 Year Dividend Streak As Valuation Screens Undervalued
summary: Southern Company (NYSE:SO) announced its latest quarterly dividend, maintaining a 78 year streak without a dividend reduction. The update extends one of the longest records of consistent dividend payments in the utility sector. The company continues to emphasize income stability for shareholders through regular cash returns. Southern, trading at $89.14, has delivered a 44.9% return over the past 3 years and 78.5% over the past 5 years, with a 1 year return of 8.5%. For income oriented...
